author: jgordon
title: Sutton United vs Arsenal: Plastic pitch should suit the Gunners in FA Cup fifth-round showdown

organizations.name: team news sutton united vs arsenal

text:
NO EXCUSES Sutton United vs Arsenal: Plastic pitch should suit the Gunners in FA Cup fifth-round showdown 
Ian Wright has tested out the playing surface and insists Arsene Wenger will not be able to blame it for defeat Comment By IAN WRIGHT, SUNSPORT COLUMNIST 17th February 2017, 10:24 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments THERE’S been a lot of talk about the 3G pitch at Gander Green Lane and what difference it might make to the game. 
What I found when I was there this week was that the grass felt quite long — longer than I expected. News Group Newspapers Ltd Ian Wright has tested out the playing surface ahead of Arsenal’s trip to Sutton 
When you try to pass the ball, it slows it down. 
Keep up to date with ALL the FA Cup news, gossip, transfers and goals plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
So Arsenal will want to make sure it gets watered to try to slicken it up. 
The quicker the pitch, the better it will be for Arsenal. 
It’s Sutton’s choice but Arsenal will certainly ask the question. 
They won’t have any problem with their grip, though — not from what I went through. 
I wore pimples rather than studs but it wasn’t like the old, rock-hard and bone-dry plastic pitches. Related Stories 'daylight robbery' Arsenal pie shop to be crippled by business rate hike while Gunners will see tax bill fall DANNY HIGGINBOTHAM The FA Cup fifth-round draw is a belter... and Arsenal and Co. could find themselves on the end even more shocks Sol mate Arsenal could make last-ditch attempt to hijack Dominic Solanke's move to Liverpool Fan-demonium Gary Neville meets Arsenal Fan TV just two weeks after labelling channel 'embarrassing' 'Let's not talk about it' Prince Harry reveals he is an Arsenal fan and is devastated after Bayern hammering Team News Sutton United vs Arsenal team news: Wenger prepares his reserves to end the Cup fairytale Ars out? Under-fire Arsene Wenger finally admits he could leave Arsenal THIS season as he faces decision over future 
This one felt spongy under my feet, really lovely, and you could get a proper grip. 
I didn’t feel in any danger of slipping. It’s certainly one of the better artificial pitches I’ve played on. 
The only thing I noticed was the bounce was slightly different to what you’d get on grass. 
I wouldn’t say it was abnormal. It’s OK but it does grip slightly more than a normal pitch, spins more and shoots off when that spin digs into the pitch. 
Back in the day when you were drawn away to a lower-division team, it was always the thought in your head that the pitch would be a leveller. News Group Newspapers Ltd Wrighty puts Sutton’s strikers through their paces before they face his former club News Group Newspapers Ltd 3 Arsenal will have perform outside their usual luxurious surroundings 
You never knew what you’d get — a mud-heap, a sand-pit, grass that was too long to try and slow you down. 
For Arsenal, the surroundings will be alien and different on Monday night. 
I don’t think anyone will like being in that small dressing room with those chocolate-brown walls, a cramped ground, the fans being right up for it. 
I’ve no doubt they’ll be vociferous, it’s the biggest night in Sutton’s history. 
But once Arsenal get their feet on the surface, they should feel very comfortable. 
The pitch, if it is running well, won’t be a leveller. 
If anything it could be a problem for Sutton, not Arsenal. It should work in Arsenal’s favour. Sutton United's Roarie Deacon tells us his Arsenal story and how he cannot wait to meet his old pals Ian Wright checks out the Sutton United players' shooting ability 
For me, the main reason is that it felt like a really big pitch. 
That means the longer the game goes on, the more space there will be — and Arsenal will have the extra fitness to take advantage of that. 
I just hope that Arsene Wenger plays some of his real stars — Alexis Sanchez or Mesut Ozil. 
I’m pretty sure he will play a reasonably strong team, with international players, but it’s such a big night for Sutton that it could mean so much for them. 
They hire out the pitch to local clubs and kids teams — and if the youngsters can say, “I played on the same pitch as Alexis” it would mean so much and inspire them. Fans reaction to Sutton United getting Arsenal in the FA Cup fifth round
